title: meschooldata Package - Maine School Enrollment Data
text: NEVER use Urban Institute API, NCES CCD, federal data source — entire point packages provide STATE-LEVEL data directly state . Federal sources aggregate/transform data differently lose state-specific details. state DOE source broken, FIX find alternative STATE source — fall back federal data.

title: meschooldata Package - Maine School Enrollment Data
text: package includes comprehensive LIVE tests tests/testthat/test-pipeline-live.R:

title: meschooldata Package - Maine School Enrollment Data
text: URL Availability Tests - Verify pages return HTTP 200 File Download Tests - Download files, verify size type File Parsing Tests - Read readxl, verify structure Column Structure Tests - Check expected sheets/columns Package Function Tests - Verify functions work correctly Cache Function Tests - Test cache operations import_local_enrollment Tests - Test local file import Data Quality Tests (skipped data available) - Inf/NaN Aggregation Tests (skipped data available) - Totals sum correctly Output Fidelity Tests (skipped data available) - tidy matches raw

title: meschooldata Package - Maine School Enrollment Data
text: NEVER push directly main. changes must go PRs auto-merge:
code: # 1. Create feature branch git checkout -b fix/description-of-change  # 2. Make changes, commit git add -A git commit -m "Fix: description of change"  # 3. Push and create PR with auto-merge git push -u origin fix/description-of-change gh pr create --title "Fix: description" --body "Description of changes" gh pr merge --auto --squash  # 4. Clean up stale branches after PR merges git checkout main && git pull && git fetch --prune origin

title: meschooldata Package - Maine School Enrollment Data
text: Clean stale branches every time touch package:
code: # Delete local branches merged to main git branch --merged main | grep -v main | xargs -r git branch -d  # Prune remote tracking branches git fetch --prune origin

title: meschooldata Package - Maine School Enrollment Data

what: 1. Maine is one of the whitest states in America
title: Maine Enrollment Trends
text: 90% Maine students white - highest percentage state east Mississippi.
code: demo <- enr_current %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian", "multiracial")) %>%   mutate(subgroup_label = reorder(subgroup, -pct))  ggplot(demo, aes(x = subgroup_label, y = pct * 100)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["total"]) +   labs(title = "Maine is One of the Whitest States",        subtitle = "Over 90% white - highest east of the Mississippi",        x = "", y = "Percent of Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Maine Enrollment Trends
text: Portland Public Schools looks nothing like rest Maine - 40% students color growing.
code: portland <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Portland", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian"))  ggplot(portland, aes(x = end_year, y = pct * 100, color = subgroup)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   scale_color_manual(values = colors,                      labels = c("Asian", "Black", "Hispanic", "White")) +   labs(title = "Portland is Diversifying Rapidly",        subtitle = "Over 40% students of color - unlike rest of Maine",        x = "School Year", y = "Percent", color = "") +   theme_readme()

what: 3. Rural Maine is losing students fast
title: Maine Enrollment Trends
text: Small SAUs Aroostook County (County) lost 20-30% enrollment since 2016.
code: state_trend <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment")  ggplot(state_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "Rural Maine Losing Students",        subtitle = "Aroostook County SAUs down 20-30% since 2016",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

what: 4. Lewiston: Somali refugees transform a mill town
title: Maine Enrollment Trends
text: Lewiston become one diverse cities New England thanks refugee resettlement.
code: lewiston <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Lewiston", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "black")  ggplot(lewiston, aes(x = end_year, y = pct * 100)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["black"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["black"]) +   labs(title = "Lewiston: Somali Refugees Transform a Mill Town",        subtitle = "Black student population growing as refugees resettle",        x = "School Year", y = "Percent Black Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Maine Enrollment Trends
text: Maine lost nearly 10% kindergartners 2021 - families kept kids home extra year.
code: k_trend <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "06", "12")) %>%   mutate(grade_label = case_when(     grade_level == "K" ~ "Kindergarten",     grade_level == "01" ~ "Grade 1",     grade_level == "06" ~ "Grade 6",     grade_level == "12" ~ "Grade 12"   ))  ggplot(k_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = grade_label)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   geom_vline(xintercept = 2021, linetype = "dashed", color = "red", alpha = 0.5) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "COVID's Kindergarten Dip",        subtitle = "Maine lost nearly 10% of kindergartners in 2021",        x = "School Year", y = "Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

title: Maine Enrollment Trends
text: Cumberland York counties gaining students rest state declines.
code: southern <- c("Portland", "South Portland", "Scarborough", "Falmouth") south_trend <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl(paste(southern, collapse = "|"), district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   group_by(end_year) %>%   summarize(n_students = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")  ggplot(south_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Southern Maine Growing",        subtitle = "Cumberland and York counties gaining while rest declines",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

what: 7. Many SAUs have fewer than 500 students
title: Maine Enrollment Trends
text: Maine tiny school districts almost state - 100 students.
code: sizes <- enr_current %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   mutate(size = case_when(     n_students < 100 ~ "Under 100",     n_students < 500 ~ "100-499",     n_students < 1000 ~ "500-999",     n_students < 5000 ~ "1,000-4,999",     TRUE ~ "5,000+"   )) %>%   group_by(size) %>%   summarize(n_districts = n(), .groups = "drop")  ggplot(sizes, aes(x = size, y = n_districts)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["total"]) +   labs(title = "Many SAUs Have Fewer Than 500 Students",        subtitle = "Maine's fragmented district structure",        x = "SAU Size", y = "Number of SAUs") +   theme_readme()

what: 8. Bangor is stable in a declining region
title: Maine Enrollment Trends
text: Bangor maintains steady enrollment surrounding Penobscot County shrinks.
code: bangor <- enr %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Bangor", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(bangor, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "Bangor: Stable in a Declining Region",        subtitle = "Maintains enrollment while Penobscot County shrinks",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

what: 9. English learners concentrated in a few districts
title: Maine Enrollment Trends
text: Portland, Lewiston, handful districts serve vast majority Maine’s EL students.
code: el <- enr_current %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "lep", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(10) %>%   mutate(district_label = reorder(district_name, n_students))  ggplot(el, aes(x = district_label, y = n_students)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["total"]) +   coord_flip() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "English Learners Concentrated in Few Districts",        subtitle = "Portland and Lewiston serve the vast majority",        x = "", y = "English Learner Students") +   theme_readme()

what: 10. The graying of Maine shows in the schools
title: Maine Enrollment Trends
text: Maine’s population aging faster state - schools feeling first.
code: ggplot(state_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "The Graying of Maine Shows in Schools",        subtitle = "Population aging faster than any other state",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Getting Started with meschooldata
text: meschooldata package provides access Maine Department Education (DOE) school enrollment data. vignette shows download work data.

title: Getting Started with meschooldata
text: Maine DOE provides enrollment data interactive QuickSight dashboard. Unlike states, data available direct programmatic download. must: Manually export data dashboard Import using import_local_enrollment() function

title: Getting Started with meschooldata
text: Run get detailed instructions: enrollment dashboard : https://www.maine.gov/doe/data-warehouse/reporting/enrollment

title: Getting Started with meschooldata
text: dashboard, select desired filters: School Year (e.g., 2023-24) Demographic group (Students, specific groups) Geographic level (State, SAU, School) Click “…” menu icon upper right visualization Select “Export CSV” “Export Excel” Save file computer

title: Getting Started with meschooldata
code: # Import the downloaded file enrollment <- import_local_enrollment("~/Downloads/enrollment_export.csv")  # View the data head(enrollment)

title: Getting Started with meschooldata
text: imported, data tidy format key columns: end_year: School year end (e.g., 2024 2023-24) type: “State”, “District”, “Campus” district_id, campus_id: Identifiers subgroup: Demographic category (e.g., “total_enrollment”, “white”, “male”) grade_level: Grade level “TOTAL” n_students: Number students pct: Percentage total

title: Getting Started with meschooldata
code: library(dplyr)  # State-level total enrollment state_totals <- enrollment %>%   filter(type == "State",          subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level == "TOTAL")  print(state_totals)

title: Getting Started with meschooldata
code: # Get demographic breakdown for state demographics <- enrollment %>%   filter(type == "State",          grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian",                           "native_american", "pacific_islander", "multiracial"))  print(demographics)

title: Getting Started with meschooldata
code: # Get enrollment by grade by_grade <- enrollment %>%   filter(type == "State",          subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level != "TOTAL")  print(by_grade)

title: Getting Started with meschooldata
text: Check years available using get_available_years():

title: Getting Started with meschooldata
text: Imported data automatically cached. want save processed data later use, save :
code: # Save for later use saveRDS(enrollment, "maine_enrollment_2024.rds")  # Load later enrollment <- readRDS("maine_enrollment_2024.rds")

title: Getting Started with meschooldata
text: working data, aware : Suppression: Small counts may suppressed protect student privacy Rounding: percentages may sum exactly 100% due rounding Missing data: schools years may incomplete data Always verify totals aggregating:
code:
# Verify race totals sum to total enrollment state_data <- enrollment %>% filter(type == "State", grade_level == "TOTAL")  total_enr <- state_data$n_students[state_data$subgroup == "total_enrollment"]  race_sum <- state_data %>%   filter(subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian",                           "native_american", "pacific_islander", "multiracial")) %>%   summarize(sum = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   pull(sum)  cat("Total enrollment:", total_enr, "
") cat("Sum of races:", race_sum, "
") cat("Match:", total_enr == race_sum, "
")

code: @Manual{,   title = {meschooldata: Maine School Data},   author = {Al Martin},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://almartin82.github.io/meschooldata}, }

title: Maine School Data
text: Documentation | Getting Started | Enrollment Trends Fetch analyze Maine school enrollment data Maine Department Education (DOE) Data Warehouse R Python.

what: What can you find with meschooldata?
title: Maine School Data
text: 10 years enrollment data (2016-2025). 175,000 students. 260+ School Administrative Units. ten stories hiding numbers (see Enrollment Trends visualizations): Maine one whitest states America - 90% students white, highest east Mississippi Portland diversifying rapidly - 40% students color, unlike rest Maine Rural Maine losing students fast - Aroostook County SAUs 20-30% since 2016 Lewiston: Somali refugees transform mill town - One diverse cities New England COVID’s kindergarten dip - Maine lost nearly 10% kindergartners 2021 Southern Maine growing - Cumberland York counties gaining rest declines Many SAUs fewer 500 students - Maine’s fragmented district structure Bangor stable declining region - Maintains enrollment Penobscot County shrinks English learners concentrated districts - Portland Lewiston serve vast majority graying Maine shows schools - Population aging faster state

title: Maine School Data
code: library(meschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2025)  # State totals enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # SAU breakdown enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(15)  # Portland demographics enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, grepl("Portland", district_name),          grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   select(district_name, subgroup, n_students, pct)

title: Maine School Data
code: import pymeschooldata as me  # Fetch one year enr_2025 = me.fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi = me.fetch_enr_multi(range(2020, 2026))  # State totals state_totals = enr_2025[     (enr_2025['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2025['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2025['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ]  # SAU breakdown sau_totals = enr_2025[     (enr_2025['is_district'] == True) &     (enr_2025['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2025['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False).head(15)  # Portland demographics portland = enr_2025[     (enr_2025['is_district'] == True) &     (enr_2025['district_name'].str.contains('Portland')) &     (enr_2025['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') &     (enr_2025['subgroup'].isin(['white', 'black', 'hispanic', 'asian'])) ][['district_name', 'subgroup', 'n_students', 'pct']]

title: Maine School Data
text: Data sourced Maine Department Education Data Warehouse: https://www.maine.gov/doe/data-warehouse/reporting/enrollment

title: Maine School Data
text: Levels: State, SAU (School Administrative Unit), School Demographics: White, Black, Hispanic, Asian, Native American, Pacific Islander, Multiracial Grade levels: PK 12

title: Maine School Data
text: Maine uses School Administrative Units (SAUs) instead districts SAU IDs 4 digits (e.g., 1000 = Lewiston) Many SAUs 1-2 schools Data available 2016 forward (historical data 2016) Maine predominantly white; small n demographic groups districts Enrollment based October 1 counts

title: Maine School Data
text: Pre-2016 historical data available package rural schools small enrollments may suppressed File URLs may change Maine DOE updates data files

Fetch Maine enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Maine Department Education (DOE) Data Warehouse. Data based Annual October 1 certified enrollment data sets.

title: Fetch Maine enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2016-present. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download Maine DOE.

title: Fetch Maine enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, campus_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Maine enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific SAU (district) portland <- enr_2024 |>   dplyr::filter(grepl("Portland", district_name)) } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi |>   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

title: Get download instructions for Maine enrollment data — get_download_instructions
code: get_download_instructions() #> ============================================================ #> Maine DOE Enrollment Data - Manual Download Required #> ============================================================ #>  #> Maine DOE has migrated enrollment data to interactive dashboards. #> Direct Excel file downloads are no longer available. #>  #> To obtain enrollment data: #>  #> 1. Visit the Maine DOE enrollment page: #>    https://www.maine.gov/doe/data-warehouse/reporting/enrollment #>  #> 2. Access the QuickFacts dashboard: #>    https://p20w.slds.maine.gov/QuickFacts #>  #> 3. Export data from the dashboard (if available) or #>    contact Maine DOE for custom data requests: #>    medms.helpdesk@maine.gov #>  #> 4. Once you have a downloaded file, use: #>    import_local_enrollment('path/to/your/file.xlsx') #>  #> ============================================================

text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs Create grade-level aggregations get_available_years List years available data

text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: meschooldata: Fetch and Process Maine School Data — meschooldata-package
text: Maine uses School Administrative Units (SAUs) organize schools: SAU IDs: 4 digits (e.g., 1000 = Lewiston) School IDs: 4 digits within SAU Combined IDs: SAU_ID + School_ID (8 characters)

title: meschooldata: Fetch and Process Maine School Data — meschooldata-package
text: Data sourced exclusively Maine DOE Data Warehouse: Maine DOE Data Warehouse (2016-present): https://www.maine.gov/doe/data-warehouse/reporting/enrollment

title: meschooldata: Fetch and Process Maine School Data — meschooldata-package
text: Years: 2016-present (Annual October 1 certified counts) Aggregation levels: State, SAU (District), School Demographics: Race/ethnicity Grade levels: PK 12

title: meschooldata: Fetch and Process Maine School Data — meschooldata-package
text: Data available 2016 forward (historical data 2016) Maine predominantly white; small n demographic groups rural schools small enrollments (suppression possible) Maine many SAUs 1-2 schools

title: meschooldata: Fetch and Process Maine School Data — meschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com
